settings.content: Thank you for using the Shella theme. It has a lot of features and options. Shella gives you the power to configure your store in a countless number of ways. With great power comes great responsibility. Be ready to spend a bit more time to become familiar with Shella power.
Start at Theme settings. You are currently at Theme settings, review it below.
Continue with Sections. There are multiple types of sections.

a) Dynamic sections - you can add or remove sections for the Home page, e.g.: Builder, Product carousel, Collections, One product. If you need any additional section, please go to Sections -> Add section.
b) Static sections - they are store-wide, e.g.: Header and Footer. Go to the Sections tab.

c) Static sections per page - unique features per page type, e.g.: 'Product Page' and 'Related product carousel' sections for product pages or 'Sidebar' and 'Head' sections for collection pages. !!! _Navigate to page_ !!! and check the Sections tab.

Please note, the list of sections in the Sections tab will be different depending on the current page. You can navigate to a needed page via store preview or using Shopify page type switcher. Please check the [Sections and theme settings](https://help.shopify.com/en/manual/using-themes/change-the-layout/theme-settings/sections-and-settings) Shopify help page for more details.
If you want to change a text of any button, checkbox, etc, go to Theme actions -> Edit languages.
Please note, the response time can be up to 1 business day. Theme support does not include Customization services, Installation services.
If you like our theme, please support us with a five stars review at [ThemeForest](https://themeforest.net/item/shella-ultimate-fashion-responsive-shopify-theme/22804833). Thank you :)

settings.info: You can find a purchase code at your themeforest.net account at the [download](https://themeforest.net/downloads) section.

Select 'Image' if you want to use and download images for logo. Or if you use 'SVG', replace the code in the logo file with yours.

settings.info: Applies only to collection page! Infinite scroll - loads next page content when you scroll to the end of the page. Load more - shows load more button at the end of the page. Classic - shows the list of pages with previous and next links.

settings.content: Configure the product variant design. You can show product options as 'Text', 'Large Text', 'Circle color', 'Circle image', 'Square color', 'Square image', or 'Select' - a dropdown list.

settings.label: Enable 'Product variants' global section for fine-tuning options
Hide options without availability variants
settings.info: Hide out of stock variants. Or show product option as unavailable.

settings.label: Auto selected options
settings.info: Separator is '|'. Example: Color|Size

settings.label: Set first image by variant on listing
Set first image by variant on product page
Visibility on listing
settings.info: Set number of options to show on collection page. 'Add to cart' button transforms to 'select options' button.

settings.label: Change variants on hover
settings.info: Change product variant on the mouse over. Only for collection item

settings.label: Options type 'Circle color'
settings.info: Separator is '|'. Show product option as circle with color background. Option name should have a [CSS color value](https://www.w3schools.com/cssref/css_colors.asp). You can configure custom values at Sections -> Product Swatches

settings.label: Options type 'Circle image'
settings.info: Separator is '|'. Show product option as circle with image. You should configure images per each product variant.

settings.label: Options type 'Square color'
settings.info: Separator is '|'. Show product option as square with color background.

settings.label: Options type 'Square image'
settings.info: Separator is '|'. Show product option as square with image.

settings.label: Options type 'Select'
settings.info: Separator is '|'. Show product option as drop-down list.

settings.label: Options type 'Large text'
settings.info: Separator is '|'. Show option as bigger text.

settings.content: [How to configure color filter at the collection sidebar](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JY_M57G3SYk)

settings.label: Image height (in % of the width)
settings.info: 100 - square image. Less than 100 - landscape. More than 100 - portrait. Doesn't work for 'Image resize = Auto'.

settings.content: Auto - if you choose this option, ignore the previous option of the image height (in % of the width). The image container and the image size are generated based on source image dimensions.
Contain - CSS object-fit = contain. If you choose this option, the image will look like: [object-fit demo](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/object-fit).
Cover - CSS object-fit = cover. If you choose this option, the image will look like [object-fit demo](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/object-fit).

Stretch by width - in this option, the image width fits the container width. It is centered vertically. If the image height is more than the container, cut the image from the top and the bottom. If the image height is less than the container, add white space at the top and the bottom of the image.
Stretch by height - in this option, the image height fits the container height. The image is centered horizontally.

settings.label: Image border-radius
settings.info: Round image corners.

settings.label: Show second images on hover
settings.info: Show second product image on mouse over

settings.label: Centered information
settings.info: Center product information under the image.

settings.info: It is used when the price of a product is more or less than it should be.

settings.content: By default theme shows currencies configured at [Shopify Payments](https://help.shopify.com/en/manual/payments/shopify-payments/multi-currency). If you want to show unsupported currencies by Shopify Payments - enable the info currency conversion below.

settings.label: Show sale price separator 'from'. Example: 120$ from 100$

settings.content: To offer multiple currencies on your online store, you must first [edit your store's currency formatting](https://mpthemes.net/shella-shopify-theme/documentation-version4/doc01-get-started.php#store-settings).

settings.label: Enable legacy method of the currency conversion
settings.info: Even though prices are displayed in different currencies, orders will still be processed in your store's currency.

settings.label: Supported
settings.info: Use the country's ISO [currency code](http://www.xe.com/iso4217.php). Separate your currency codes with a space.

settings.info: Separator is '|'

settings.default: USD - US Dollar|EUR - Euro|GBP - British Pound

settings.content: Our recommendations: 1) track all your custom changes which you apply to the theme. It will help you greatly in the future theme update. (We recommend GIT), 2) keep your changes as separately as you can. Next two options is a good example how to keep CSS and JS code separately.

settings.label: Enable custom CSS file
settings.info: Add your custom CSS style to a separate file. Rename custom-example.css file to custom.css.

settings.label: Enable custom JavaScript file
settings.info: Add your custom JavaScript code to a separate file. Rename custom-example.js file to custom.js

settings.content: Configuration of the parameters for the different variants of the estimated delivery section.
IMPORTANT: ONLY USE INTEGER NUMBERS FOR THE CONFIGURATION

settings.info: Use only 24 hours format, for example for 2 PM use 14

settings.info: Number of days to the first probable delivery date from the day of purchase

settings.info: Number of days from the first probable delivery date to calculate the maximum date
